titles.title: Older Workers' Earnings Protection Act of 1993
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to phase out the earnings test over a 5-year period for individuals who have attained retirement age, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 2/4/1993--Introduced. Older Workers' Earnings Protection Act of 1993 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase the amount of outside income which beneficiaries who have attained retirement age may earn during 1995 through 1999 without incurring a reduction in benefits. Repeals such income limitation in the year 2000. Accelerates the effective dates of increases in the delayed retirement credit rate for individuals who work beyond retirement age.
